properties.areaDesc: Northern Wasatch Front; Cache Valley/Utah Portion
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 3:19PM MST until January 13 at 10:00AM MST by NWS Salt Lake City UT
properties.description:
...One storm exits with the next storm late tonight through
Monday...

.The storm that impacted much of northern Utah this weekend will
exit this evening. Immediately behind this exiting storm, a new
but relatively short duration storm will reach far northern Utah
late this evening, then sweep south across northern Utah late
tonight through Monday morning. Accumulating snows will develop
near the Idaho border late this evening, then spread south along
the urban corridor through mid-morning Monday. Snows will taper
off in the valleys late Monday morning, but continue heavy at
time along the Wasatch range into the afternoon.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6
inches.

* WHERE...Cache Valley/Utah Portion and Northern Wasatch Front.

* WHEN...From midnight tonight to 10 AM MST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could significantly impact the morning commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snows will likely occur during
the Monday morning commute. Allow extra travel time.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including
Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit
weather.gov/slc/winter.

For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of
Transportation, visit
http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial
511.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 10 AM MST MONDAY
